title: Lawmakers Include Boeing 737 MAX Waiver in Spending Bill; A provision in the omnibus legislation would lift a deadline for two new aircraft but require safety improvements for all 737 MAX jets
text:
The provision contained in the omnibus bill instead would require some safety enhancements, though short of what current law would require, on all 737 MAX jets to be made pending certification by U.S. air-safety regulators.

Boeing declined to comment.

Write to Andrew Tangel at andrew.tangel@wsj.com

Lawmakers Include Boeing 737 MAX Waiver in Spending Bill
